sentence.Network_en: There was a long silence, and my father looked shamefaced.
sentence.Network_cn: 沉默持续了很长时间，而我父亲看上去面带愧色。

sentence.Network_en: And a While , the young man stood by , shamefaced , and downat - heel , submitting.
sentence.Network_cn: 年轻男人一直低头站在那里,满脸羞涩, 唯唯诺诺.

sentence.Network_en: Do not be so shamefaced. You'll do it very well.
sentence.Network_cn: 别那么脸皮薄,你会做得很好的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'modest, shy'): alteration of archaic shamefast, by association with face

entry.tran: 面带愧色的;羞愧的;惭愧的
entry.def: If you are shamefaced, you feel embarrassed because you have done something that you know you should not have done.

example.ex: There was a long silence, and my father looked shamefaced.
example.tran: 沉默持续了很长时间，而我父亲看上去面带愧色。

sentences.sentence: "cheerfully bearing reproaches but shamefaced at praise"- H.O.Taylor
"the hangdog and shamefaced air of the retreating enemy"- Eric Linklater

auth_sentence.content: He felt shamefaced as a schoolboy before the great world.
auth_sentence.res_content: He felt shamefaced as a schoolboy before the great world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He felt shamefaced as a schoolboy before the great world.

auth_sentence.content: He, at least, had had the grace to be shamefaced.
auth_sentence.res_content: He, at least, had had the grace to be shamefaced.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He, at least, had had the grace to be shamefaced.
